title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy from Methuen seeks her lost wedding dress after a 15-year mix-up at a closed dry cleaner.
Dunleavy found she had someone else's gown, quickly reuniting it with the owner, but her dress remains missing.
The missing gown features buttons, flower appliqué, and 'KS' initials. Dunleavy appeals on social media for information.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples performed at Chevalier Theatre in Medford, blending gospel-soul roots with modern Americana influences.
Staples delivered a 12-song, 65-minute set emphasizing joy and protest, including songs like 'Freedom Highway' and 'No Time for Crying.'
The 86-year-old artist balanced uplifting music with social commentary on issues like ICE and civil rights, energizing the audience.

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: The Red Sox are adopting MLB's new ABS challenge system, allowing players to challenge balls and strikes starting in 2026.
Wilson Contreras was the first Red Sox player to successfully challenge a call using the ABS system in spring training.
Each MLB team will get two ABS challenges per game, retaining them if successful; players initiate challenges, not coaches.

title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito remains unsigned in free agency after opting out of his Red Sox contract in 2025.
Garrett Crochet expresses surprise at Giolito's free-agent status, citing his strong 2025 performance and value.
The Red Sox have strengthened their rotation with Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, diminishing chances of Giolito's return.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr. is a potential trade candidate due to his $29 million cap number and Indianapolis' other priorities.
Bears' DJ Moore, another possible trade target for the Patriots, had 50 receptions for 682 yards and six touchdowns in 2025.
Jaguars' Walker Little could strengthen the Patriots' offensive line and is on the trade market with a $12 million cap hit.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in five-on-five scrimmage but still has no return date following an Achilles tear.
The Celtics posted practice photos of Tatum, sparking speculation about a possible return.
Celtics are playing upcoming home games, but Tatum's return remains uncertain this season.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered a memorable call during Team USA's overtime win in women's hockey for NBC Sports.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir showed restraint in commentary during Alysa Liu's gold-winning figure skating routine.
Providence led U.S. markets in viewership rating for the Super Bowl, while Seattle had the highest share of TVs tuned to the game.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended — for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free bus program for routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using unspent federal pandemic relief funds.
Mayor Michelle Wu launched the free ride initiative in 2022, using $8 million in pandemic funds, covering $340,000 monthly costs.
City and MBTA officials are discussing the program's future as current funding only supports the extension until June.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snow total with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches as of Saturday morning.
Essex County towns reported significant snowfall, with Haverhill seeing up to 5 inches by Saturday morning.
A new high-impact winter storm is forecast to hit Massachusetts from Sunday night into Monday with possible blizzard conditions.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims.
LaRosa is inspired by her coworker Annie, who has completed the Boston Marathon 24 times.
April 20, 2026, will be significant for LaRosa as she credits the marathon with personal growth.
